vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ποδ-ήρης, ες,
reaching to the feet, πέπλοι, χιτὼν π., a robe that falls over the feet, [Refs 5th c.BC+] of the High Priest's robe, [LXX]; π. ἀσπίς large shield which covered the body down to the feet, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 ναῦς π. a ship with feet, i.e. oars, [Refs 5th c.AD+]; στῦλος π. a firmly based pillar, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__3 τὰ π. parts about the feet, feet, [Refs 4th c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: reaching to the feet; (n.) robe reaching to the feet floorlength
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
reaching to the feet; (n.) robe reaching to the feet floorlength
reaching to the feet;, as subst. i.e. ἐσθής, a long, flowing robe reaching down to the feet, Rev. 1:13*
